title: MaterialRelation
description:
The <font color="#4f81bd">MaterialRelation</font> class describes the relationships between constituent parts in an <font color="#4f81bd">EarthMaterial</font> (e.g. A mineral overgrowth on a phenocryst within a granite).  
Example:  Consider an overgrowth of albite on plagioclase in a granite. The Source would originate with the albite constituentPart description.  In this case, the Target would point to the plagioclase <font color="#4f81bd">constituentPart</font> description and the relationship attribute would be 'overgrowth' and the <font color="#4f81bd">sourceRole</font> is 'overgrows'.  Other appropriate role attributes might include: crosscuts, replaces, etc. for crosscutting and replacement relationships.  Inverse relationships must be explicitly recorded.

relationship.title: relationship
relationship.description: The property <font color="#4f81bd">relationship:GeologicRelationshipTerm</font> contains a term from a controlled vocabulary to describe the geologic relationship (e.g., sedimentary relation, igneous relation).

sourceRole.title: sourceRole
sourceRole.description: The property <font color="#4f81bd">sourceRole:RelationRoleTerm</font> contains a term that describes the role played by the source earth material part (e.g., matrix, clast, overgrowth).

targetRole.title: targetRole
targetRole.description: The property <font color="#4f81bd">targetRole:RelationRoleTerm</font> contains a term describing the role played by the target earth material part (e.g., matrix, clast, overgrowth).
